isis.stitle: INTERNATIONAL® VT 365 DIESEL ENGINE - CYLINDER HEAD AND VALVE TRAIN - Component Reassembly - Rocker Arm Carrier

figure.caption: Figure 192. Alignment guides and dowel sleeve bushing in old cylinder head (eight tapped M8 holes)
Figure 193. Alignment guides and dowel sleeve bushing in new cylinder head (two tapped M8 holes)

note.para: Dowels may still be attached to the cylinder head side of the rocker arm carrier.

step1.para: Install cylinder head/rocker carrier alignment guides (make locally) in position shown before installing rocker arm carrier.

Rotate the crankshaft until damper locating dowel hole is in the six o'clock position. This positions all pistons below TDC so the valves do not contact the pistons when tightening the rocker arm assemblies.
Apply engine oil to the top center of each valve bridge.
Place rocker arm carrier onto guides.
Install eight or two bolts in rocker arm carrier and tighten to the standard torque .

note.para: If installing eight M8 x 50 bolts, pay close attention to rocker carrier alignment dowels when tightening down rocker arm carriers. It may be necessary to tighten the top four bolts first, then the lower bolts, to ensure correct engagement of dowels.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage use only permanent ink markers to identify bolt torque orientation.
To prevent engine damage, check to make sure push rod has seated in the rocker arm pocket.

To prevent engine damage, install new M14 x 193 head bolts when installing the cylinder head. Lightly lubricate new bolt threads and mating surfaces of bolt flanges with clean engine oil. Too much oil will cause hydrostatic lock and give incorrect torque reading.
Do not use antiseize compounds, grease, or any other lubricant except engine oil. Other lubricants have an adverse effect on torque results.

step1.para: Lightly lubricate new M14 x 193 cylinder head bolts with clean engine oil. Install eight bolts into the open positions finger tight.
Remove the two rocker arm carrier alignment guides and replace with the two remaining new oiled bolts finger tight.
